file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 78-31-02-04 - UPPER DOOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL UPPER DOOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the thrust-reverser upper door. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH thrust reversers. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY THRUST-REVERSER UPPER DOOR - RE- ALL 78-31-02-000-801-A MOVAL THRUST-REVERSER UPPER DOOR - IN- ALL 78-31-02-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 78-31-02 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 78-31-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. THRUST-REVERSER UPPER DOOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey these instructions to remove the thrust-reverser upper door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 54-52-01-000-801-A/400 PYLON FAIRINGS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 78-31-01-940-801-A/200 THRUST REVERSER - OPENING PROCEDURE ENGINE THRUST-REVERSER MICROSWITCH (DE- AMM TASK 78-34-02-000-801-A/400 PLOY) - REMOVAL AMM TASK 78-34-03-000-801-A/400 DEPLOY MICROSWITCH STRIKER - REMOVAL S.B.145-78-0032 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 416 416SL LH Thrust reverser left side 416 416VZ LH Thrust reverser left side 416 416RR LH Thrust reverser right side 416 416XZ LH Thrust reverser right side 416 416MT LH Thrust reverser upper side 416 416NT LH Thrust reverser upper side 426 426SL RH Thrust reverser left side 426 426VZ RH Thrust reverser left side 426 426RR RH Thrust reverser right side 426 426XZ RH Thrust reverser right side 426 426MT RH Thrust reverser upper side 426 426NT RH Thrust reverser upper side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine nacelle available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Remove the thrust-reverser door Thrust reverser I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: • REFER TO THE GROUND SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 WHEN YOU DO THE THRUST REVERSER MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. • MAKE SURE THAT THE ELECTRICAL POWER SUPPLY IS REMOVED FROM THE THRUST REVERSERS. ENERGIZED CIRCUITS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. • MAKE SURE THAT THE HYDRAULIC TEST STAND IS NOT CONNECTED. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT ALL THE HYDRAULIC LINES ARE CONNECTED NOT TO PERMIT THE HYDRAULIC OIL TO FALL OUT. (1) Put the workstand under the thrust reverser. (2) Open the thrust-reverser doors (AMM TASK 78-31-01-940-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • THRUST REVERSER 1/2. • HYD. ELEC. PUMP 1/2. (4) Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-THRUST-REVERSERS sign on the instrument panel, in the cockpit. (5) Remove the pylon trailing-edge fairing ( AMM TASK 54-52-01-000-801-A/400). (6) For aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-78-0032, remove the deploy microswitch striker to prevent damage to the door, striker and thrust reverser structure ( AMM TASK 78-34-03-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT APPLY HYDRAULIC POWER TO THE AIRCRAFT, AND DO NOT OPERATE THE THRUST REVERSER WHILE THE MAINTENANCE PERSONS ARE AT WORK. (7) Remove pivot upper access panels 416SL, 416RR, 426SL, and 426RR ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) to get access, at the pivot point, to the door attaching point outer side of the 3-o'clock beam and 9-o'clock beam. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (8) Remove the upper deploy microswitch (AMM TASK 78-34-02-000-801-A/400). (9) Through the thrust-reverser door hole, remove pivot-point cover access panels 416XZ and 426XZ ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) to get access, at the pivot point, to the door attaching point inner side of the 3-o'clock door side. (10) From the upper pivot door outer surface, remove circular access panels 416MT, 416NT, 426MT, and 426NT ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) to get access to the actuator bolt at the door attaching point. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the plate (16) and the support (17). (2) Remove the detachable seal compressor (14). (3) Remove the split pin (1), nut (2), and washers (3). (4) Remove the actuator attaching bolt (4) and sliding bearing (5). WARNING: KEEP THE DOOR IN ITS DEPLOYED POSITION BECAUSE, AFTER THE ACTUATOR BOLT IS REMOVED FROM THE DOOR, THE MOVEMENT OF THE DOOR AROUND THE PIVOT POINTS IS FREE. LET THE ACTUATOR MOVE AT THE BOX ATTACHING POINT UNTIL IT STAYS AT A STABLE POSITION. (5) Through the access panels removed before, on the 3-o'clock beam and 9-o'clock beam outer surface and on the pivot door 3-o'clock side and 9-o'clock side inner surface, remove the cotter pin (6), nut (7), and washer (8), and let the pivot bolt (9) hold the upper door to the structure. (6) From the 3-o'clock and 9-o'clock pivot points, remove the pivot bolts (9) which also hold the upper door. CAUTION: KEEP THE UPPER PIVOT DOOR ON A TRESTLE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE DOOR. (7) Remove the upper pivot door. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 4 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Thrust-Reverser Upper Door - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 1 E A ZONES 416 426 1 TORQUE: 120 N.m TO 140 N.m (1062 lb.in TO 1239 lb.in) 9. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 78-31-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. THRUST-REVERSER UPPER DOOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey these instructions to install the thrust-reverser upper door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION - - AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 54-52-01-400-801-A/400 PYLON FAIRINGS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 78-31-01-820-801-A/500 THRUST REVERSER - RIGGING PROCEDURE THRUST REVERSER - MANUAL RIGGING PROCE- AMM TASK 78-31-01-820-802-A/500 DURE AMM TASK 78-31-01-940-802-A/200 THRUST REVERSER - CLOSURE PROCEDURE AMM TASK 78-31-05-400-801-A/400 THRUST-REVERSER PIVOT BOLTS - INSTALLATION ENGINE THRUST-REVERSER MICROSWITCH (DE- AMM TASK 78-34-02-400-801-A/400 PLOY) - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 78-34-03-400-801-A/400 DEPLOY MICROSWITCH STRIKER - INSTALLATION S.B.145-78-0032 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 416 416SL LH Thrust reverser left side 416 416VZ LH Thrust reverser left side 416 416RR LH Thrust reverser right side 416 416XZ LH Thrust reverser right side 416 416MT LH Thrust reverser upper side 416 416NT LH Thrust reverser upper side 426 426SL RH Thrust reverser left side 426 426VZ RH Thrust reverser left side 426 426RR RH Thrust reverser right side 426 426XZ RH Thrust reverser right side 426 426MT RH Thrust reverser upper side 426 426NT RH Thrust reverser upper side EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine nacelle available Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the attachment nuts available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Dow Corning Molykote P40 or P37 Metal-free adhesive lubricating paste AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Split pin - 1 Cotter pin - 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Thrust reverser I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING: • REFER TO THE GROUND SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 WHEN YOU DO THE THRUST REVERSER MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. • CLEANING PRODUCTS ARE TOXIC AND FLAMMABLE. A GOOD FLOW OF AIR MUST BE AVAILABLE WHEN THE WORK IS DONE IN A CLOSED AREA. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 8 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION: • MAKE SURE THAT ALL THE HYDRAULIC LINES ARE CONNECTED NOT TO PERMIT THE HYDRAULIC OIL TO FALL OUT. • DO NOT PERMIT THE CLEANING PRODUCT TO TOUCH PAINT-FINISH SURFACES NOT TO CAUSE DAMAGE TO THEM. • USE CLEAN, SOFT (COTTON), NON-SYNTHETIC, AND LINT-FREE CLOTHS ONLY. DO NOT PUT REMAINING CLEANING MATERIAL BACK INTO ORIGINAL CONTAINERS TO PREVENT CONTAMINATION. • DO NOT POUR CLEANING PRODUCT DIRECTLY ON THE SURFACE TO BE CLEANED. • DO NOT PERMIT CLEANING PRODUCT TO EVAPORATE BEFORE IT IS DRIED WITH THE CLOTH. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • THRUST REVERSER 1/2. • HYD. ELEC. PUMP 1/2. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: • MAKE SURE THAT THE ELECTRICAL POWER SUPPLY IS REMOVED FROM THE THRUST REVERSERS. ENERGIZED CIRCUITS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. • MAKE SURE THAT THE HYDRAULIC TEST STAND IS NOT CONNECTED. CAUTION:THRUST REVERSER DOORS S/N 769 AND ON HAVE CARBON FIBER SIDEWALLS. WHEN YOU INSTALL THIS DOOR, CONTACT WITH THE STRUCTURE CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SIDEWALLS. PROTECT THE EDGES OF THE SIDEWALLS WHEN YOU REMOVE THE DOORS. CAUTION: GREASE CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE COATING OF SOME PIVOT DOOR BEARINGS. ONLY APPLY GREASE TO BEARINGS THAT HAVE PART NUMBER RBF12DAT. YOU MUST NOT APPLY GREASE TO BEARINGS THAT HAVE OTHER PART NUMBER. (1) (Applicable only to pivot door bearing P/N RBF12DAT) Apply Dow Corning P40 or P37 (in grease form) to the full face of the pivot door bearing ball. To do this, turn the bearing out of its housing and apply the grease largely with a brush. Make sure that the maximum surface area of the bearing face is covered. (2) Put the thrust-reverser upper door, on the thrust-reverse module, in its deployed position. CAUTION: DO NOT WET-ASSEMBLE OR LUBRICATE THE PIVOT BOLTS. THE PIVOT BOLTS HAVE A COATING THAT DOES NOT NEED LUBRICANT. (3) Align the upper door fittings with the pivot attaching holes in the 3-o'clock and 9-o'clock upper beams, and install the pivot bolts (9) (AMM TASK 78-31-05-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 9 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Make sure that the actuator is at its maximum length (deployed position). (5) Align the upper-door actuator-shaft head with the attaching fitting point at the inner surface of the door. (6) With the door fitting and actuator head aligned, and through the circular access holes in the outer surface of the door, install the actuator bolt (4). (7) Install the sliding bearing (5), washers (3), nut (2), and split pin (1). (8) Install the support (17) and the plate (16). (9) Install the plate (14). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A CAUTION: EXAMINE ALL THE WORK ZONES TO MAKE SURE THAT YOU DID NOT LET TOOLS OR OTHER EQUIPMENT STAY BEHIND. (1) Install the deploy microswitch (AMM TASK 78-34-02-400-801-A/400). (2) For aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-78-0032, install the deploy microswitch striker ( AMM TASK 78-34-03-400-801-A/400). (3) Through the thrust-reverser door hole, install pivot point cover access panels 416XZ and 426XZ ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100), on the inner side of the upper door at the 3- o'clock. (4) On the upper-pivot outer surface, install circular access panels 416MT, 416NT, 426MT, and 426NT ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100). (5) Install upper-pivot access panels 416SL, 416RR, 426SL, and 426RR ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) on the 3-o'clock and 9-o'clock outer surface. (6) Install the pylon trailing-edge fairing ( AMM TASK 54-52-01-400-801-A/400). (7) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • THRUST REVERSER 1/2. • HYD. ELEC. PUMP 1/2. (8) Close the thrust-reverser doors ( AMM TASK 78-31-01-940-802-A/200). (9) Remove the DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-THRUST-REVERSERS sign from the instrument panel, in the cockpit. (10) Remove the workstand from the work area. CAUTION: THRUST REVERSER RIGGING IS NECESSARY TO MAKE SURE OF THE CORRECT THRUST REVERSER OPERATION. IF THE THRUST REVERSER IS NOT CORRECTLY RIGGED, FAILURE MESSAGES WILL COME INTO VIEW ON THE EICAS AND CMC, AND CAUSE INTERRUPTIONS IN THE AIRCRAFT OPERATION. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 10 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (11) Do the thrust-reverser rigging procedure ( AMM TASK 78-31-01-820-801-A/500) or ( AMM TASK 78-31-01-820-802-A/500), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-31-02 Page 11 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
